ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I think the most valuable thing I gained from this course was how to approach abstraction from an observational lens. Sophy put a big emphasis on how all painting, regardless of how "realistic" is an act of abstraction, and how just because something is done from observation does not restrain you to a particular interpretation of local color or composition.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Great observation sessions on Thursdays. Good site selection. Its the right amount of time and a cool way to approach works, typically going from start to finish in a specific observation section. 

Could maybe use a little more structure especially first half of term. Also more feedback/ crits. Maybe one addition could be more directed workshops on Tuesday classes for technique
I think this course would benefit from more structured in-class exercises toward the beginning. It was a little disorientingly freeform from the outset

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Take it with Sophy if you cangreat person & painting teacher. Youll get lots of time, space, and freedom to grow as a painter. Thursday field trips are a great way to activate yourself as a painter (and also explore some less-trodden parts of campus & New Haven).
Depends on whether you thrive in a really open ended and often on-site creative environment. If you require a bit more of a sterilized and structured painting experience then no.
